traceability.evidence: 1. src/config-loader.js implements loadConfigFile that reads .dry-aged-deps.json (or custom path via --config-file), parses JSON, validates schema (allowed keys: minAge, severity, prod, dev, format), enforces type and value constraints, and exits with code 2 on errors (invalid JSON, missing file when --config-file used, unknown keys, invalid values). 2. src/cli-options.js merges config file values with CLI flags using precedence CLI > config > defaults, covering format, minAge, prod/dev thresholds, and severity thresholds. 3. README.md documents the --config-file flag, example .dry-aged-deps.json schema, and usage with and without flags. 4. Comprehensive tests in test/cli.config-file.test.js cover: • Applying defaults from config file when no flags provided • CLI flags override config values • Invalid JSON causes exit code 2 with appropriate error message • Unknown config key causes exit code 2 with error message • Invalid minAge values (<1 or >365) cause exit code 2 with validation message • Custom config file name support and missing-file error handling 5. Additional tests in test/cli.flags.test.js verify defaulting behavior when no config file is present. All acceptance criteria are met and tests pass with exit codes and output as specified.
traceability.notes: The implementation fully satisfies the 010.0-DEV-CONFIG-FILE-SUPPORT story: configuration file loading, schema validation, error handling, CLI override precedence, optional use, documentation, and comprehensive test coverage are in place.
